remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常不会 直接使用类。You do not typically use the class directly. 和 类继承自此类。The and classes inherit from this class. 类充当需要滚动功能的控件的基类。The class acts as a base class for controls that require the ability to scroll. 若要启用控件以根据需要显示滚动条，请将 属性设置为， `true` 并将 属性设置为所需的大小。To enable a control to display scroll bars as needed, set the property to `true` and set the property to the desired size. 当控件的大小小于指定的最小大小，或者子控件位于控件的边界之外时，将显示相应的滚动条。When the control is sized smaller than the specified minimum size, or a child control is located outside the bounds of the control, the appropriate scroll bars are displayed. 当开发通过显示滚动条来响应布局更改的自定义控件时，请设置 和 属性。When developing custom controls that respond to layout changes by displaying scroll bars, set the and properties. 如果不显示任何滚动条，请将相应的属性设置为 `false` ，即使 属性设置为也是如此 `true` 。If either scroll bar is not visible, set the corresponding property to `false`, even if the property is set to `true`. 您可以处理 事件，以了解用户或代码滚动工作区的时间。You can handle the event to know when the user or code scrolls the client area. 以编程方式将控件添加到窗体时，可以使用 属性将控件放置在当前可查看滚动区域的内部或外部。When adding controls programmatically to a form, use the property to position the control either inside or outside of the current viewable scroll area.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 自动滚动边距是任何子控件和可滚动父控件边缘之间的距离。The auto-scroll margin is the distance between any child controls and the edges of the scrollable parent control. 将 大小添加到可滚动控件中包含的任何子控件的大小，以确定是否需要滚动条。The size is added to the size of any child controls contained in the scrollable control to determine whether or not scroll bars are needed. 当调整父可滚动控件的大小时，或将各个子控件置于视图中时，将计算属性，并使用来确定是否必须显示滚动条。The property is evaluated when the parent scrollable control is resized or the individual child controls are brought into view, and is used to determine if scroll bars must be displayed. 停靠控件从确定是否必须显示滚动条的计算中排除。Docked controls are excluded from the calculations that determine if scroll bars must be displayed. > [!NOTE] > 如果停靠控件的 属性设置为，则在 使用 确定是否需要滚动条时，控件将填充父可滚动控件并忽略停靠的控件。If a docked control's property is set to , the control fills the parent scrollable control and the docked control is ignored when using the to determine whether scroll bars are needed. 如果从子控件的边缘到父可滚动控件的距离小于分配给该属性的值， 并且 属性设置为 `true` ，则会显示相应的滚动条。If the distance from the edge of a child control to the parent scrollable control is less than the value assigned to the property and the property is set to `true`, the appropriate scroll bar is displayed. > [!NOTE] > 建议在可滚动控件内停靠控件时，添加一个子可滚动控件（如 ），以包含可能需要滚动的任何其他控件。We recommend, when docking controls within a scrollable control, that you add a child scrollable control, such as a , to contain any other controls that might require scrolling. 应将子控件添加 到可滚动的控件，并将其 属性设置为 ，并将其 属性设置为 `true` 。You should add the child control to the scrollable control and its property set to and its property set to `true`. 应将父可 滚动控件的属性设置为 `false` 。You should set the property of the parent scrollable control to `false`. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用派生类 。The following code example uses the derived class, . 该示例将计算文本框的位置，并更改其父容器（panel 控件）的外观和行为。The example evaluates the location of a text box and changes the appearance and behavior of its parent container, the panel control. 该示例要求您已经创建了一个 控件、和的实例 。The example requires that you have created an instance of a control, , and . 将文本框置于面板上，使其至少与面板的一个边缘重叠。Place the text box on the panel so that it overlaps at least one of the panel's edges. 在单击按钮时调用此函数可查看面板的行为和外观上的差异。Call this function on the click of a button to see the difference in the panel's behavior and appearance.
